revised_title: Last Labyrinthodont: A New Brachyopoid Fossil Amphibian from Early Jurassic Evergreen Formation
tldr: A nearly complete skull and postcranial skeleton of a temnospondyl labyrinthodont, a type of amphibian, was discovered in the Upper Evergreen Formation of southeast Queensland, Australia. This find, a new genus and species of the family Chigutisauridae, is significant as the last known labyrinthodont and indicates the presence of a terrestrial Early Jurassic fauna. The fossil provides evidence that labyrinthodonts survived beyond the end of the Triassic period.
